metadata.title: USN-6465-1 -- Linux kernel vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Yu Hao and Weiteng Chen discovered that the Bluetooth HCI UART driver in the Linux kernel contained a race condition, leading to a null pointer dereference vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2023-31083)  Lin Ma discovered that the Netlink Transformation (XFRM) subsystem in the Linux kernel contained a null pointer dereference vulnerability in some situations. A local privileged attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2023-3772)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6465-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  linux-image-5.15.0-1032-gkeop - 5.15.0-1032.38 linux-gkeop-tools-5.15.0-1032 - 5.15.0-1032.38 linux-buildinfo-5.15.0-1032-gkeop -
